title: Dawn Butler MP receives apology three weeks after racist incident
text:
Dawn Butler received a personal apology on the same day Lib Dem leader Jo Swinson wrote to her about the incident (Picture: PA/Twitter)

An MP accused by a Liberal Democrat staffer of lying about her experiences of racism in Parliament said she has only just received a personal apology – nearly three weeks after the incident.

Labour’s Dawn Butler says Steve Wilson – the husband and chief of staff of MP Angela Smith – was ‘forced’ to say sorry because his response only arrived yesterday, on the same day as a letter from Lib Dem leader Jo Swinson.

Mr Wilson, who had earlier publicly apologised for the incident, wrote: ‘Further to recent events considering comments made on Twitter, I would like to apologise wholeheartedly for the comments I made and the subsequent offence I caused.’

But Ms Butler, who is the Shadow Shadow Women and Equalities Secretary, wants the office of Mrs Smith – who previously apologised for saying people of colour had ‘a funny tinge’ – to undergo diversity training.

In a column written for Metro.co.uk, she previously revealed two incidents of racism she faced in Parliament – one of which Mr Smith labelled ‘just not true’.

In a letter to Ms Swinson, Ms Butler had previously said such comments ‘legitimise’ and ‘actively promote racism’.

The Brent Central MP accused the Lib Dem of ‘gaslighting’ her with ‘deeply disturbing trolling’, and called for disciplinary action.

She went on to detail two incidents of discrimination against her in Parliament, during an exclusive interview with Metro.co.uk.

In her response to the letter, Ms Swinson wrote yesterday: ‘I want to be very clear that I absolutely believe that your experience in the lift is genuine, and I think it is vital that when these experiences are shared that they are believed and not dismissed. I entirely agree with you that there is no place in modern society for language that seeks to divide us.

‘All Liberal Democrat MPs and their staff are expected to undertake the “Valuing Everyone” training which was put in place as part of the Independent Complaints and Grievance Scheme.’

But Ms Butler is unimpressed with the Lib Dem reaction, which comes 20 days after the column was written.

She said: ‘It has taken almost three weeks to get a one-line apology from Steven Wilson and what’s clear from this is he was forced to do so. It’s disappointing that it only came after my formal complaint to the Liberal Democrats

‘It’s still unclear however, whether Jo Swinson has followed her party’s disciplinary procedure and taken action against Steven Wilson; he should be disciplined for his behaviour and be required to undergo diversity training.’

description: Labour's Dawn Butler said it has taken three weeks to get 'a one-line apology' from Steve Wilson - husband of Lib Dem MP Angela Smith.
